column4: could anyone help me with SSH? I'm trying to ssh into a work server, i can ping it, 22 is set to forward, my 22 is open but ssh times out every time
you have root on the box? sometimes i have to use the https port on some locked down networks. you can add Port 443 under Port 22 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
yes they gave me the root username, are you saying to add 443 on the client or the server machine
server. im sure your problem is something else but if youre not using 443 for another service you could try that
